alert.note: Alert for Barbour; Lewis; Northwest Randolph; Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 4:41AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Randolph, southeastern Lewis, Upshur and southern Barbour Counties through 515 AM EDT... At 441 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Buckhannon, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elkins, Buckhannon, Philippi, Audra State Park, Belington, Rock Cave, Junior, Womelsdorf (Coalton), Montrose, Volga, Lorentz, Kerens, Walkersville, Ellamore, Tallmansville, Overhill, Hodgesville, Horner and French Creek. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 91 and 92. Route 33 between mile markers 2 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
